description: Rain-kissed streets, Khasi hills and indie beats — a playlist for wandering Shillong afternoons.

items.name: Cathedral Of Mary Help Of Christians
items.description: The current cathedral is one that was rebuilt over the remains of the first Cathedral of Mary Help of Christians that was engulfed in flames during a fire in 1936. The church is constructed based on Gothic architecture. It also has an underground grotto church. On a clear day, one can get the magnificent visage of the Himalayas and the Brahmaputra River from the Church (located on a small hill). The church attracts a lot of tourists for its amazing architecture and glass work.

items.name: All Saints Church
items.description: This is one of the oldest churches in Shillong. The All Saints Church Shillong was built during the British rule in 1897 but was demolished by an earthquake. It was reconstructed in 1902 and the location of the church was chosen by the British who thought that it resembled Scotland. The church was built based on colonial architecture.

items.name: Shillong Baptist Church
items.opening_hours_text: 7 am to 6:30 pm (Mon-Sat), 8 am to 6:30 pm (Sun)

items.name: Pentecostal Church Of God
items.description: While Shillong is comprised of many churches, the Indian Pentecostal Church of God is the only Malayalam Pentecostal Church in the city. Located in Laitumkhrah, approximately 3 km from the city and close to the hospital of Nazareth. Their mission is to win for Christ the lost.

items.name: Jaiaw Presbyterian Church
items.description: This is one of the largest churches in the area, having beautiful interiors, usually open most days. All the services are offered in the local language. In case you want to visit church, better do it on a Sunday or special occasion where you can see the higher magnitude of people in attendance. Occasionally, they have soothing music and it's conveniently right near a hospital. Apart from the pleasing ambience, all the people of that place are very welcoming and generous.

items.name: Seventh-Day Adventist Church
items.description: On March-April 1941, the new seventh-day Church of Advent in Laitumkhrah, Shillong was assigned to action. At that time, there were 15 to 20 leaders. This church, now, more than 70 years later, has members of different dialects and languages. At the moment, the following vernacular groups are identified, such as Khasi, Garo, Mizo, Hindi or the group of English-speaking people that find it more comfortable to read and study God's Word.
items.opening_hours_text: Prayer meeting (6 pm Tuesday), Bible study (3.30 pm Sabbath)

items.name: Umpling Presbyterian Church
items.opening_hours_text: Mon to Sat, 7 am to 4.30 pm
